title: 105_hr4046
content: Restrictions on transfers or discharges of nursing facility residents in case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program. Continuing rights for nursing facilities voluntarily withdrawing from Medicaid program. Facilities voluntarily withdrawing from a State Medicaid plan can continue providing services without transferring or discharging residents. Residents of a facility can be transferred or discharged if the facility voluntarily withdraws from a State Medicaid plan. The provisions of this section apply to residents until their discharge from the facility. Residents of a facility must be notified orally and in writing when the facility withdraws from a State Medicaid plan. This notification requirement applies until the residents are discharged from the facility. Residents of a facility must be notified orally and in writing when the facility withdraws from a State Medicaid plan. The facility must provide notice to individuals upon admission, including specific information, and obtain a written acknowledgment of receipt from each individual. The facility must provide specific information to individuals upon admission and obtain a written acknowledgment of receipt from each individual, separate from other signed documents. This does not affect any participation agreement requirements for nursing facilities. The facility must provide specific information to individuals upon admission, separate from other signed documents. This does not affect any participation agreement requirements for nursing facilities. The nursing facility must give advance notice to the State or Secretary before terminating the agreement. Information for new residents includes the facility's non-participation in the program and the possibility of transfer. The facility can transfer or discharge a resident who is unable to pay, even if they are eligible for medical assistance. The facility can discharge a resident if they are unable to pay, even if eligible for medical assistance. Continuation of payments and oversight authority for nursing facility services under this title, even after voluntary withdrawal from participation under the State plan. The participation agreement of a facility continues under the State plan after voluntary withdrawal for receiving payments and maintaining compliance with requirements. The facility's participation agreement under the State plan includes receiving payments, maintaining compliance with requirements, and applying survey authority. The facility must comply with all requirements under the title, including survey authority and enforcement. The provisions of this subparagraph apply to significant voluntary reductions in participation under a State plan for a resident within 90 days of the reduction. The provisions of this subparagraph apply to a significant voluntary reduction in participation under a State plan for a resident entitled to medical assistance with nursing facility services. The reduction's effective date entitles individuals to medical assistance for nursing facility services similar to voluntary withdrawal. The paragraph does not apply to new residents. The paragraph regarding voluntary withdrawals from participation does not apply to new residents who begin residence in a facility after the effective date of the withdrawal. The amendment regarding voluntary withdrawals from participation does not apply to new residents who start living in a facility after the withdrawal's effective date. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must report to Congress on the impact of the implementation within 5 years of the Act's enactment. The amendment on voluntary withdrawals from participation applies to withdrawals occurring after the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must report to Congress on the impact of the amendment within 5 years. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must report to Congress on the impact of changes in Medicaid reimbursement rates for nursing facility services, including the extent of voluntary withdrawals from the Medicaid program and recommendations for legislative changes.
